sentences: Choi Seo-ah (Korean: 최서아; born Choi Jun-hee on 3 September 1993) better known by her stage name Juniel (Hangul: 주니엘, often stylized as JUNIEL) is a South Korean singer-songwriter.
section: N/A

sentences: She began her career in Japan before eventually debuting in South Korea.
section: N/A

sentences: She was first known as 'Junie', but eventually changed her stage name to 'Juniel', which was derived from combining her name, Junie, and L for 'love'.
section: N/A

sentences: She was also a member of the duo Romantic J with CNBLUE's Lee Jong-hyun under former label FNC Entertainment.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2016, Juniel announced on her social media that she legally changed her native name from 최준희 (Choi Jun-hee) to 최서아 (Choi Seo-ah).
section: N/A

sentences: Choi Jun-hee was born on 3 September 1993, in South Korea.
section: == Life and career == | === 1993–10: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: As a child, she began dancing and singing, with popular soloist BoA being her inspiration.
section: == Life and career == | === 1993–10: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: She started playing the guitar in her third year of junior high school.
section: == Life and career == | === 1993–10: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: She wrote her first song, "Boy", when she was sixteen, which was later included on her first Japanese EP.
section: == Life and career == | === 1993–10: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: While studying in Japan, she won the Japanese audition program Niji Iro Supernova, beating out many other singers and songwriters from all over the country.
section: == Life and career == | === 1993–10: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Juniel started her Korean training at Good Entertainment, the same agency which formerly housed celebrities such as G. NA, the Wonder Girls' Yubin and After School's Uee.
section: == Life and career == | === 1993–10: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: She later auditioned at FNC Entertainment, and became a trainee the same day as CN Blue's Jung Yong-hwa.
section: == Life and career == | === 1993–10: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: 2013: Juni, Fall in L, DOKKUN PROJECT and Romantic J

== Life and career == | === 2013: Juni, Fall in L, DOKKUN PROJECT and Romantic J ===

sentences: Juniel received the Rookie Award at the 27th Golden Disk Awards on 15 January 2013, in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, and was invited to perform at MIDEM festival's Happy Hour Business Party in Cannes, France, on 27 January 2013.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013: Juni, Fall in L, DOKKUN PROJECT and Romantic J ===

sentences: She released her debut Japanese studio album Juni on 6 March 2013, which consists of eleven self-composed songs and a Japanese version of the duet "Babo" with CNBLUE's Jung Yong-hwa.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013: Juni, Fall in L, DOKKUN PROJECT and Romantic J ===

sentences: A month later, her third extended play titled Fall in L released on 25 April 2013.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013: Juni, Fall in L, DOKKUN PROJECT and Romantic J ===

sentences: The EP is composed of four songs: the lead track "Gwiyeoun Namja" (귀여운 남자; "Pretty Boy"), "Date" (데이트), "Jamkkodae" (잠꼬대; "Sleep Talking") and "My Lips".
section: == Life and career == | === 2013: Juni, Fall in L, DOKKUN PROJECT and Romantic J ===

sentences: On the same day of its release, "Gwiyeoun Namja" topped several Korean real-time music charts.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013: Juni, Fall in L, DOKKUN PROJECT and Romantic J ===

sentences: On 2 May 2013, Juniel was appointed honorary ambassador for teenagers at the 2013 Teenage Family Month Ceremony.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013: Juni, Fall in L, DOKKUN PROJECT and Romantic J ===

sentences: On 18 July, Juniel released a digital single titled "Love You More Than Ever" featuring Hanhae from PHANTOM as a part of producer Kim Do Hoon's 'DOKKUN PROJECT'.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013: Juni, Fall in L, DOKKUN PROJECT and Romantic J ===

sentences: The song immediately topped the online Korean music charts such as Bugs, Soribada & Naver Music after its release.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013: Juni, Fall in L, DOKKUN PROJECT and Romantic J ===

sentences: On 9 December, Juniel and CNBLUE's Lee Jonghyun formed a duet and released a winter special digital album called 'Romantic J' with the song titled "Love Falls".
section: == Life and career == | === 2013: Juni, Fall in L, DOKKUN PROJECT and Romantic J ===

sentences: The song was inspired by the movie "Music and Lyrics", where Lee Jonghyun is the music composer and Juniel as the lyricist.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013: Juni, Fall in L, DOKKUN PROJECT and Romantic J ===
